humanum_full_description_en:
The shape of an oracle bone inscription resembling a broomstick is the first article of " Comet ". The original meaning is broom, and the extension is sweeping. " Comet " is also used as "篲", " 𥱵 ", "Shuwen": "Comet, sweep bamboo. Congyou hold the chute. Zou, comet or from the bamboo. 𥱵, the ancient text of the comet, from the bamboo from the study." See "篲".

Because comets are shaped like brooms and have long tails, "comets" are also called "broom stars" and "broom stars". The ancients generally believed that comets are evil stars, so the colloquial phrase "broom star" is a derogatory term to describe someone not only bad luck, but also affects those around them and is detrimental to others. "Er Ya" in the second volume of "All Classics" quoting Sun Yan's note: "Wise, demon star also." "Chun Qiu Gongyang Biography. "The Fourteenth Year of Wen Gong": "Remembering the Differences." He Xiu's Note: "The one who sweeps the past and sets up a new image." "New Preface. Miscellaneous Four": "There is a comet in the sky to eliminate filth." "Comet" is also called "孛" (孛星), "茀" (茀星), "Guliang Biography. "The Fourteenth Year of Wengong": "Autumn and July, there are stars and puppies entering the Beidou, and puppies are still words." "Historical Records. "Tianguanshu": "Xingxiu Yu Heshu." Sima Zhensuoyin: "Qiao, that is, the widow star." See " Comet ".

In addition to being used as names of people and places, oracle bone inscriptions indicate the meaning of removal. For example, "Compilation" 13613: "Wang Jishou, Zhongrihui", it means that the king of Shang had a headache, and he was relieved and recovered at noon (Yang Shuda).

Han silk book means comet, "Mawangdui Han silk book. "Fifty-two prescriptions for diseases" stated in lines 52-53 to treat infantile lumps: "Zhuzhi said: the sprayer will spray, the upper...like a comet, the lower is like the blood of 䏽(衃)", which means that Zhu said: water The spitting person sprayed fiercely, above...like a broom star, below like necrotic condensed blood.

The ancients used a broom to wipe out diseases, "Mawangdui Han Silk Book. "Fifty-two prescriptions for warts" stated in line 104: "If there is water in the mounds of the moon and sun, use a broom to show (sweep) and especially (warts) twenty-seven." (Sweep) You (wart) North. "Into the broom well." " Warts " is a skin disease. "Dark days" are the 29th or 30th of each month in the lunar calendar. There is no moonlight all night, which is unlucky and treats the disease. Good time for magic. The general idea is that after the warts grow, on the 29th or 30th of each month in the lunar calendar, when there is water in the empty dry well, go to the side of the well and use the old broom to sweep the warts 14 times. , Sweep the warts, the warts will be defeated and flee.” After sweeping the warts, immediately discard the broom in the well (see Yan Jianmin). Tang Sun Simiao's "A Thousand Gold Essential Prescriptions" Vol. 23 also has the method of "sweeping three or seven times with a bald broom" to remove warts, which can be used as evidence for the extension of " comet " from broomstick to disease healing (see Qiu Xigui).

humanum_full_description:
甲骨文象掃帚之形，為「彗」之初文。本義為掃帚，引申為掃除。「彗」亦作「篲」、「𥱵」，《說文》：「彗，掃竹也。从又持甡。篲，彗或从竹。𥱵，古文彗，从竹从習。」參見「篲」。

　　因為彗星的形狀像掃把，有長長的彗尾，所以「彗星」又叫「掃帚星」、「掃把星」。古人一般認為彗星是凶星，所以俗語「掃把星」是貶義詞，形容某人不但自己的運氣不好，而且會連累身邊的人，對他人不利。《一切經音義》卷二引《爾雅》孫炎注：「慧，妖星也。」《春秋公羊傳．文公十四年》：「記異也。」何休注：「篲者，掃故置新之象也。」《新序．雜事四》：「天之有彗，以除穢也。」「彗星」又稱為「孛」（孛星）、「茀」（茀星），《穀梁傳．文公十四年》：「秋，七月，有星孛入于北斗，孛之為言猶茀也。」《史記．天官書》：「星茀于河戍。」 司馬貞索隱：「茀，即孛星也。」參見「彗」。

　　甲骨文除用作人名、地名外，表示除去之義，如《合集》13613：「王疾首，中日彗」，是說商王頭痛，正午時病除、病愈（楊樹達）。

　　漢帛書表示彗星，《馬王堆漢帛書．五十二病方》第52-53行所載治嬰兒瘈方云：「祝之曰：噴者劇噴，上……如彗星，下如䏽（衃）血」，意謂祝告說：含水噴吐的人激烈地噴，上面……像掃把星，下面像壞死凝聚的血。

　　古人有用掃把掃除疾病的習俗，《馬王堆漢帛書．五十二病方》第104行所載治疣方云：「以月晦日之丘井有水者，以敝帚騷（掃）尤（疣）二七，祝曰：『今日月晦，騷（掃）尤（疣）北。』入帚井中。」「疣」是一種皮膚病，「晦日」是陰曆每月的二十九或三十日，整夜無月光，不吉利，是治病魔的好時機。大意是說生疣後，到陰曆每月的二十九或三十日，待空的枯井有水時到井旁邊去，用舊掃把掃疣十四次，掃時祝告說：「今日是晦日，掃疣，疣必會戰敗逃走。」掃完疣後，立即將掃把丟棄到井中（參嚴健民）。唐孫思邈《千金要方》卷二十三去疣方也有「以秃條帚掃三七遍」的方法，可作為「彗」由掃把義引申為病愈義的佐證（參裘錫圭）。

Комета
«Шуовэнь»: «Комета, подмети бамбук». Персонаж Сяочжуань как будто держит в одной руке два бамбука.
«Цзо Чжуань»: «Итак, приходите избавляться от старого и нового».
Термин «комета» впервые появился в «Эр Я», написанном более двух тысяч лет назад и названном в честь своей формы, напоминающей бамбуковую метлу.
